info.name: Spinal cord, lateral column
info.description: The lateral column or funiculus of the spinal cord is that portion of the white matter that is located between the dorsal lateral sulcus (point of entry of the dorsal roots) and the ventral lateral sulcus (point of exit of the ventral roots). Present bilaterally, it contains both ascending and descending tracts including the clinically important corticospinal tract and part of the spinothalamic tract.
